alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 4:36AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches over populated or traveled regions, but 10 to 20 inches over the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, strongest over exposed terrain and during Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills, South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains, and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes much of Highway 138, Diamond Lake Junction on Highway 230, Highway 62 and higher potions of Highway 138. * WHEN...From 1 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could reach 1 inch per hour at times Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades
